column4: Hey, I've just installed Ubuntu as a dual with Window XP (Pre installed) and I have a problem with the start screen for selecting which OS to boot in. My keyboard seems to not work, but as soon as ubuntu loads it works. It's wireless and a Belkin one, any ideas?
enable legacy usb in your BIOS
umm well what type of PC do you have?
reboot and when you see the splash screen hit Delete I think
It should say at the bottom of your screen right when your monitor comes on which key to press to enter setup
Yeah, I can enter the BIOS, but is activating the Legacy USB easy to find? If so I'll jsut hunt around a bit.
np. I had the same problem :P
Thanks, it worked. Is it possible to change the order of the list in the "Select your OS", I'd prefer Windows XP to be at the top.
you can rearrange the menu, or just set 'default' to be the XP selection
I'm in /boot/grub/, which file do I have to edit now?
Do I just move this "title: Windows.. blah blah, root, etc" up in the list of the other ones? is it safe to remove the divider?
or just change the default to be the 2nd/3rd/whatever
I've entered that command, but it doesn't seemed to have had any effect.
Okay it's let me save it. I'll test it now. Thankyou.
